meanings.definition: Highly responsive or reactive to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The ultrasensitive microphone picked up even the faintest sounds.
meanings.sent2: Her skin was ultrasensitive to the touch, making her shiver at the lightest caress.
meanings.sent3: The ultrasensitive alarm system went off when a squirrel sneezed outside.
meanings.sent4: His ultrasensitive intuition warned him of the impending danger before anyone else noticed.
meanings.sent5: The ultrasensitive thermometer could detect the slightest change in temperature.

meanings.definition: Easily affected or influenced by external factors.
meanings.sent1: She was ultrasensitive to criticism, often taking it to heart.
meanings.sent2: The delicate flower was ultrasensitive to changes in sunlight and water.
meanings.sent3: His ultrasensitive mood swings made it hard for others to predict his reactions.
meanings.sent4: The ultrasensitive scale could detect even the tiniest weight difference.
meanings.sent5: The ultrasensitive compass pointed north with the slightest movement.

meanings.sent1: The ultrasensitive artist could perceive emotions in the slightest brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: Her ultrasensitive nature allowed her to empathize deeply with others.
meanings.sent3: The ultrasensitive cat could hear a mouse tiptoeing from miles away.
meanings.sent4: His ultrasensitive taste buds could distinguish between different types of salt.
meanings.sent5: The ultrasensitive radar detected the approaching storm long before it hit.
